Which Credit Card has the best welcome offers?
Each credit card offers a special welcome promotion to new customers, whether it’s cash back, air miles or popular gifts like luggage, electronic devices and more, you can easily compare and find the best welcome offers with comparison in MoneySmart.
Types of credit card Welcome rewards
Cashback, air miles, coupons and gifts are the most common welcome offers, compare and select your favourite rewards before applying for a new credit card:
Cashback
Cashback credit cards offer a certain percentage of the spending amount back as rewards. Cardholders can earn extra cash rebates as welcome offers upon successful application and designated spending in the first few months.
Air Miles
Credit cards often provide a tremendous air miles welcome offer to travel lovers. Cardholders can get thousands of air miles, including Asia Miles and Avios, upon designated spending and redeem air tickets for free.
Gifts/Vouchers
Some credit cards provide welcome gifts or supermarket vouchers instead of cashback and airmiles, popular choice of welcome gifts include electronic devices and luggages.
How to get welcome promotions from credit cards?
Most credit cards require cardholders to spend a designated amount to earn the welcome offers of your choice, take Citi Cash Back Card as an example, cardholders can earn up to HK$800 Wellcome Cash Coupon upon accumulating spending of HK$10,000 or above within the first 2 months.
Some credit cards have no minimum spending requirement, where cardholders can earn welcome offers with a special rate for eligible transactions within the first few months of card issuance, like Standard Chartered Asia Miles Credit Card, cardholders can earn Asia Miles with conversion rate as low as HK$0.2 = 1 Asia Mile.

Frequently Asked Questions
Can I get my credit card welcome offer right after my application?
It depends. After applying for credit cards, you need to fulfill the spending requirements to get welcome offers. Take HSBC Red Card as an example, you’ll need to spend $6,000+ in the first 60 days of card issuance, and use RewardCash to pay for credit card statement or transaction via the “Pay with RC” function in Reward+ to get $1,000 RewardCash welcome offer. Credit cards set limits to not only spending amounts but also spending categories. For example, HSBC credit cards don’t count online bill payments and e-wallet transactions as eligible spending. Make sure you’ve read the Terms and Conditions before swiping your credit cards! But there are some credit cards that give you welcome gifts once your application is approved. Standard Chartered Simply Cash Visa Card gives you 25% cashback for local spending in the first 2 months and up to $1,000 cashback without spending requirements.
Are welcome offers for new customers only?
Generally, yes. Most of the credit cards only prepare welcome offers for new customers, which means that you haven’t held or cancelled credit cards of your designated bank in the past 6-12 months. But some credit cards still give welcome offers to existing customers, but the value of the offer is lower than the new customers. HSBC Visa Signature Card is a good example: they offer up to $800 welcome gifts to new customers, but $400 welcome gifts for existing customers.
Is there anything I need to know while applying for welcome offer credit cards?
After getting your welcome offer, most of the banks reserve the right to charge you a handling fee and take back your welcome offer without any notice if you cancel their credit cards in 12 months of card issuance.
When will I receive my welcome offer?
If you fulfil the spending requirement, like BOC credit cards, they’ll credit the welcome offer directly to your credit card account in 4 to 6 weeks. But make sure your account is working, valid and under a good credit. For other banks, they have their own policies so it’s better for you to check the Terms and Conditions.
Do I need to consider anything else apart from welcome offers?
Yes! Welcome offers are attractive, but it’s still a one-time reward. The basic rebate rate after the introductory period should be one of your considerations. Besides that, you should find out your spending pattern. Say, dining is your main expenses, then you should pick a credit card with the most dining offers. Plus, get to know why you’re applying for a credit card, then pinpoint your expenses to get the most offers like cash back and air miles.
Can I cancel my credit card after receiving the welcome offers?
It varies from card to card. In general, if a cardholder cancels the card in less than 12 months from the date the card is issued, a fee which is equivalent to the value of the welcome offers/ administration fee will be charged.
